subject: Personal Finance
title: Hyperinflation's Endgame
description: A quick win: understand Hyperinflation's Endgame.

hook.text: Every hyperinflation in history ended one of two ways: new currency or new government.

buildup.text: When inflation spirals beyond control, the existing currency becomes worthless.

discovery.text: Germany created the Rentenmark. Brazil created the Real. Zimbabwe adopted the US dollar.

twist.text: The new currency only works if people trust it. Trust requires credible institutions and fiscal discipline.

climax.text: Brazil's Real Plan of 1994 worked brilliantly. A new currency with credible backing ended decades of chaos.

punchline.text: To fix money, sometimes you replace it.

quiz.question: How do countries typically end hyperinflation?
options: By introducing a new, credible currency
